div.div:
Examples of 'maximally different' combinations that a 'maximal difference (creativity)-generating graph' should be able to identify:
- adding facts/connections in a graph
- descriptions of networks using structures like filters/barriers/buffers
- graph of graphs
- proving absoluteness/generality/scope of a connection
- specifying intents into implementations
- defining thresholds/ratios
- relevance of query, given a graph and a problem/intent
- intent/difference to solution/similarity loops to select/organize "differences to resolve"
- optimal filter tests
- interactive (intersecting,Â invalidating, limiting) independent (maximally different) variables
- absolute relevance of numerical values
- definition spectrums like define/identify/filter/sort/limit or intent/requirement or certainty/definition/constant
- connect problem/solution networks with similarities

switch.text: Examples of 'maximally different' combinations that a 'maximal difference (creativity)-generating gra...

div.div:
Example 'orthogonal intersecting spectrum graph' that can generate maximal differences like the examples below
The point of this intersecting graph of spectrums is that the spectrums represent highly different variables but they overlap with other spectrums, so they can be connected at these overlaps to create a 'similarity network' of spectrums. Other interface spectrums like structure spectrums involving similar structures like graphs/maps/networks can be integrated.

switch.text: Example 'orthogonal intersecting spectrum graph' that can generate...
